description.narrative: Suzano Petroquimica S.A. (Suzano or the company) is one of the largest petrochemical companies in Brazil that, through its controlled company Polibrasil Resinas S.A. (Polibrasil), and its joint controlled companies, Politeno Industria e Comercio S.A. (Politeno) and Petroflex Industria e Comercio S.A. (Petroflex), produces, markets and distributes petrochemical products. The company was incorporated in 2001 as a result of a corporate reorganization that culminated in a spin-off of all petrochemical assets then held by Companhia Suzano de Papel e Celulose (a former IFC client). These companies produce three main products: polypropylene (PP), in the case of Polibrasil, polyethylene (PE), and synthetic elastomers, which are sold in both the domestic and the international markets. The company also has a controlling block of a new company, Rio Polimeros S.A. (Rio Polimeros), which is building the first petrochemical complex in Brazil that will use natural gas fractions as raw material and has integrated ethylene and polyethylene production units. The project under consideration includes the buyout of Basell''s 50% stake in Polibrasil with the aim to hold 100% ownership of the company, the announced corporate restructuring, the debottlenecking of Polibrasils operations and debt refinancing. The acquisition was announced on June 20, 2005 and was completed on September 1st 2005. By taking full control of Polibrasil, Suzano will become an operating company, positioned as one of Latin Americas largest thermoplastic resins producers and the largest PP producer. This acquisition enables Suzano to become a major integrated petrochemicals player, instead of an investor and holding company, positioning itself as a consolidating agent in the Brazilian petrochemical sector in the Southeast region. Suzano will also implement a corporate restructuring aimed at simplifying its group structure and turn itself into an operational company as disclosed to the market on its press release of September 1st, 2005.

name.narrative: The industrial complex of Polibrasil is formed by three facilities producing polypropylene resins with a combined annual production capacity of 625.0 thousand tons, located in the municipalities of Duque de Caxias, State of Rio de Janeiro, Mauá, State of São Paulo, and Camaçari, State of Bahia. Inaugurated in 1992, the Duque de Caxias facility has a production capacity of 200.0 thousand tons per year, and produces homopolymers and random copolymers using Lipp technology. The new polypropylene industrial facility located in Mauá has world-size production scale of 300.0 thousand tons per year, using the latest generation Spheripol technology licensed by Basell Polyolefins and is located in Brazil''s main consumer market. The Camaçari industrial facility in Bahia was inaugurated in 1978. This facility has an installed capacity of 125.0 thousand tons per year, and produces homopolymers and heterophasic copolymers.
